intro: Euscaphis japonica f. eburnea, commonly known as the Japanese euscaphis, is a rare and ornamental plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Cornaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, dark-barked trunk and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces elliptical, glossy leaves that turn red in the autumn, adding visual interest to the landscape. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Due to its rarity and aesthetic appeal, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
